author: dildick
body:
#### PR description:

* First major part: The GEM-CSC trigger will use clusters in Run-3 (not single GEM pads) which will be sent to the ME1/1 optical trigger motherboards over 9.6 Gb/s optical fibers as explained in [DN-20-016](https://gitlab.cern.ch/tdr/notes/DN-20-016/-/blob/master/nodraft/DN-20-016_temp.pdf). This PR finally removes the option to run on single pads (which was the normal way since CMSSW_6_2_X_SLHC).
* Second major part of the pull request is a working version of https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/31401, with the intent of making the CSC trigger configuration easier to understand. All psets for ALCT, CLCT, TMB, MPC and CCLUT are put in `python/params` rather than directly in `cscTriggerPrimitiveDigis_cfi`, reducing the main configuration to less than 100 lines. Thus `params/` contains
```
python/params/
* alctParams_cfi
* clctParams_cfi
* tmbParams_cfi
* auxiliaryParams_cfi
* cclutParams_cfi
* __init__.py
```
* `SLHC` was renamed to `Phase2` everwhere
* `alctClctOffset_` was made a constant, defined in CSCConstants.h
* `use_run3_patterns_` and `use_comparator_codes_` were merged into `runCCLUT_` (because we will not run the Run-3 patterns without CCLUT)

#### PR validation:

Code compiles. Rebase from #31460 which was stuck in failing `code-checks`.  Performance plots can be found in the #31460 conversation.

title: Remove option to run on single GEM pads; Simplify CSC trigger configuration
